isis.stitle: INSTRUMENTS (Data Link Driven Instrument Cluster) - FE 300 and IC Bus - TROUBLESHOOTING (INDICATOR AND WARNING LIGHT DIAGNOSTICS) - (ABS) ANTI-LOCK BRAKE WARNING LIGHT

svcsubproc.title: FE 300 With WTEC or Allison 2000 ICT Air Brakes

table.title: FE 300 With WTEC or Allison 2000 ICT Air Brakes

entry.para: Disconnect ABS ECU connector (288) and use a test jumper to connect pin E3 to ground. Move key switch to ignition position. Does ABS warning light illuminate?
Warning light circuits test good. Turn key off, reconnect conn. (288), and turn key on. If warning light does not illuminate during bulb check, reprogram/ replace ECU.
Loosen cluster and remove (ABS) anti-lock brake warning light bulb. Test for continuity.
Re-install bulb. Go to next step.
Replace defective bulb and reconnect connector. Repeat all tests if problem persists.
Disconnect connector (297), move key switch to ignition position, and measure voltage from circuit A94B to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuits A13K, A13E or A94B from fuse (F27), then repair.
Remove warning light relay (284), and at relay socket, measure voltage from circuit A94E to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit A94E, then repair.
At relay socket (284), measure voltage from circuit A94E to A94-GA.
Locate open or poor connection in circuits A94-GA, A94-GB or A11-GB, then repair.
With jumper still connected at ECU, at relay socket (284), measure voltage from circuit A94E to A94H.
Locate open or poor connection in circuits A94H, conn. (451) or gray wire, then repair.
Bench test warning light relay (284) by measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87A.
Bench test warning light relay (284) by applying +12V to pin 86, gnd. to pin 85, and measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87.
Re-install warning light relay, and with jumper still installed at connector (288), move key switch to ignition position. Does warning light illuminate?
ABS warning light circuits test good. Turn key off. Reconnect conn. (288) and turn key on. If warning light does not illuminate during bulb check, reprogram/ replace ECU.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit A94E, then repair.
Disconnect ABS ECU connector (279) and use a test jumper to connect pin 1 to ground. Move key switch to ignition position. Does ABS warning light illuminate?
Warning light circuits test good. Turn key off, reconnect conn. (279), and turn key on. If warning light does not illuminate during bulb check, reprogram/ replace ECU.
Loosen cluster and remove (ABS) anti-lock brake warning light bulb. Test for continuity.
Re-install bulb. Go to next step.
Replace defective bulb and reconnect connector. Repeat all tests if problem persists.
Disconnect connector (422), move key switch to ignition position, and measure voltage from circuit A94B to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuits A28, A13N or A94B from fuse (F22), then repair.
Remove warning light relay (R1), and at relay socket, measure voltage from circuit A94E to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit A94E, then repair.
At relay socket (R1),, measure voltage from circuit A94E to A94-GB.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit A94-GB or A11-G, then repair.
With jumper still connected at ECU, at relay socket (R1),, measure voltage from circuit A94E to A94H.
Locate open or poor connection in circuits A94H, conn. (2), K94H, conn. (261), K94H, or gray wire, then repair.
Bench test warning light relay (R1), by measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87A.
Bench test warning light relay (R1), by applying +12V to pin 86, gnd. to pin 85, and measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87.
Re-install warning light relay, and with jumper still installed at connector (279), move key switch to ignition position. Does warning light illuminate?
ABS warning light circuits test good. Turn key off. Reconnect conn. (279) and turn key on. If warning light does not illuminate during bulb check, reprogram/ replace ECU.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit A94E, then repair.
Disconnect ABS ECU connector (288) and use a test jumper to connect pin E3 to ground. Move key switch to ignition position. Does ABS warning light illuminate?
Warning light circuits test good. Turn key off, reconnect conn. (288), and turn key on. If warning light does not illuminate during bulb check, reprogram/ replace ECU.
Loosen cluster and remove antilock brake warning light bulb. Test for continuity.
Re-install bulb. Go to next step.
Replace defective bulb and reconnect connector. Repeat all tests if problem persists.
Disconnect connector (297), move key switch to ignition position, and measure voltage from circuit 94D to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 28 or 94D from fuse (F24), then repair.
Remove warning light relay (R4), and at relay socket, measure voltage from circuit 94F to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 94F, then repair.
At relay socket (R4), measure voltage from circuit 94E to 94-GC.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 94-GB, circuit 94-GC or 11-G, then repair.
With jumper still connected at ECU, at relay socket (R4), measure voltage from circuit 94H.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 94H, conn. (2), 94H or gray wire, then repair.
Bench test warning light relay (R4) by measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87A.
Bench test warning light relay (R4) by applying +12V to pin 86, gnd. to pin 85, and measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87.
Re-install warning light relay, and with jumper still installed at connector (288), move key switch to ignition position. Does warning light illuminate?
ABS warning light circuits test good. Turn key off. Reconnect conn. (288) and turn key on. If warning light does not illuminate during bulb check, reprogram/ replace ECU.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 94E, then repair.
Disconnect ABS ECU connector (279) and use a test jumper to connect pin 1 to ground. Move key switch to ignition position. Does ABS warning light illuminate?
Warning light circuits test good. Turn key off, reconnect conn. (279), and turn key on. If warning light does not illuminate during bulb check, reprogram/ replace ECU.
Loosen cluster and remove antilock brake warning light bulb. Test for continuity.
Re-install bulb. Go to next step.
Replace defective bulb and reconnect connector. Repeat all tests if problem persists.
Disconnect connector (R4), move key switch to ignition position, and measure voltage from circuit 94D to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 28 or 94D from fuse (F24), then repair.
Remove warning light relay (R4), and at relay socket, measure voltage from circuit 94F to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 94F, then repair.
At relay socket (R4), measure voltage from circuit 94E to 94-GC.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 94-GB, circuit 94-GC or 11-G, then repair.
With jumper still connected at ECU, at relay socket (R4), measure voltage from circuit 94H.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 94H, conn. (2), 94H or gray wire, then repair.
Bench test warning light relay (R4) by measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87A.
Bench test warning light relay (R4) by applying +12V to pin 86, gnd. to pin 85, and measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87.
Re-install warning light relay, and with jumper still installed at connector (279), move key switch to ignition position. Does warning light illuminate?
ABS warning light circuits test good. Turn key off. Reconnect conn. (279) and turn key on. If warning light does not illuminate during bulb check, reprogram/ replace ECU.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 94E, then repair.
